name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has five Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs) conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. These SLOs are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The revision process for these learner outcomes began in the Spring of the 2017-2018 academic year. The school's mission is to teach and nurture the 'whole' child—intellectually, spiritually, emotionally, and physically—and to instill principles of submission to the Will of Allah for personal and academic excellence. Their goals include teaching a love for Islam, practicing Islam daily, achieving first-rate academic standards, striving for excellence to compete effectively, and developing strong moral and spiritual character, self-worth, discipline, independence, ethical standards, love of learning, citizenship, and responsibility. The Islamic Education curriculum also aims for students to live Islam through submission to Allah, know Islam's history, use the Qur'an and Sunnah for decisions, take Prophet Muhammad (SAW) as a role model, and become lifelong learners by developing good study habits and being intellectual and well-rounded.

evaluationSources: Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC)

zakatClaimEvidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat-eligible' funds. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/943311132#financials)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School shows exceptional impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat-eligible' funds. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/943311132#financials)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 98.1% and fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Total revenue for the period was $4,155,519, with 9.1 months of working capital available.
The school's mission is to meet the educational needs of Muslim children in the Greater Sacramento area.
Al-Arqam Islamic School operates as a college preparatory institution.
The school implements the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 66/100 due to its high direct impact on capacity building through education and excellent financial efficiency, though its alignment score is moderated by a specific regional focus.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public data regarding specific long-term student outcomes and impact metrics
Low alignment for donors seeking high-urgency global humanitarian interventions

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the school maintains a strong track record in the Sacramento community, the alignment score is medium due to a localized donor fit and the specific nature of private religious education compared to high-urgency global causes [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 98.1% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised [1][2]. Its focus on capacity building through the IB Diploma Program and college preparatory academics provides direct educational value to its beneficiaries [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides a rigorous International Baccalaureate and college preparatory education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, indicating nearly all revenue goes directly to educational services
Offers the prestigious International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program
Strong financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children in Greater Sacramento [3]. The school integrates a College Preparatory curriculum with the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program to foster high academic standards and leadership [4][5].
